definition: to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]

sentences.english: This led to corner cutting and-with surprising frequency-falsification of data.
sentences.chinese: 其結果導致投機取巧了，僞造數據資料，其。

sentences.english: Besides, change according to changing circumstances and fluke mind exists in the majority of people.
sentences.chinese: 此外，投機取巧和僥倖心理大多數人都有這種心理。

sentences.english: A gimmicky or imbalanced team relies on one powerful tactic to win.
sentences.chinese: 投機取巧的團隊依靠單一的強力戰術制勝。

sentences.english: He wants no members in his political party who are lust along for the ride.
sentences.chinese: 他不想讓投機取巧者在他的政黨裏。

definition: to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to lack foresight
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
misconception/fallacy
to become a mere formality
hidebound by convention (idiom)
to advance prematurely
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to act in a way that defeats one's purpose (idiom)
arbitrary/subjective/dogmatic
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
